website_summaries.verdict: An alternative to glasses models, these are an investment for those who want to watch many eclipses over the coming years, but they do not offer maximum protection.
pros: A unique goggle design with thermal green lenses that provide intense eclipse viewing with CE and ISO standard protection
Adjustable strap fits most kids and adults
cons: No padding around the lenses make them uncomfortable for extended wear
Some wearers noted light coming in around the edges of the goggles

customer_reviews.title: Not hokey costume goggles!
customer_reviews.text: After buying pre-made Steampunk goggles, and seeing how hokey they were, I bought these as a base for making better. I chose well. These are solid, injection molded impact plastic, with cutting-torch grade lens tints (actually usable as really dark sunglasses), the nose bridge is bead-chain covered by a protective plastic tube, rather than a molded plastic chunk. Whether you actually want to work metal, or get your Steampunk on, these are the type of goggles you want. Even if they ARE just for show, the quality difference from cheap molded goggles will show that you really CARE about looking the part. Tl;dr: You want good goggles, these are GOOD goggles!
customer_reviews.author: Anime Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great Goggles!!
customer_reviews.text: The lenses included are a #5 shade. The lenses included are NOT safe for welding or solar viewing. I gave 5 stars because they fit great, come with a clear plastic holding lens that is interchangeable and are very comfortable! I ordered 2 pairs with the intention of using them to watch the total eclipse on August 21st. I supplemented this purchase with another one for 4 individual 50mm round lenses that are #14 shade which is what is recommended for solar viewing and welding.
customer_reviews.author: April Baxa

customer_reviews.title: My favorite type of cutting glasses .
customer_reviews.text: I use these to allow me to fit in tight locations around semis when cutting. The field of view gained I find is worth an discomfort or fogging I get with these. I will buy them again and wish I had them if I am using a torch somewhere other than the shop. The only exception is when there is alot of splatter I use a welding helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Paul V

customer_reviews.title: Beware: yours might arrive unusable.
customer_reviews.text: These came with severe damage to the lenses. Some kind of smudging. There is a fingerprint literally embedded in the material of the lenses, as if someone grabbed them while they were being molded. There was also a hair of some kind stuck in the frame. What's that about? Anyway, these are not usable and I can't be bothered to start a return for a $10 item. Maybe I got very unlucky. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hobart OxyAce Goggles
customer_reviews.text: These things fit and adjust very easy! While I don't give a flying what I look like when I am cutting, these do look very cool. They do their job well and protect my eyes when I am using my torch, both from light and from flying debris. The middle nose piece was uncomfortable on the bridge of my nose so I removed it and left the bare chain which has been of no consequence to me. I think these are good enough that I have an extra pair in my box should something bad ever happen to the ones I have in service atm.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but not protected during shipping
customer_reviews.text: Cool looking goggles, fit well but have not worn for an extended amount of time so I can't say if they're good for extended use. I usually have trouble with headwear because I have a big head but these fit with no issues. What kinda sucks is they came scratched in the box. I'm only using them for part of my Halloween costume and the scratches don't effect the view much (it's already pretty dark) but they are noticible. These will look good with my costume, but would be upset if I bought these for work.
customer_reviews.author: Mario D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal for $8.99. The goggles are actually solid and made pretty well. Perfect for my purposes. It took me a minute to figure out that the plastic disc "lenses" are disposable shipping protection for the good quality glass lenses. I'm very happy with this purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cole

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very please, especially for the price. Has adjustable elastic strap for the band that goes around your head. The bridge for over the nose is adjustable with a ball chain. I may cut the chain and support pipe even shorter to fit me better. Eye cups twist off well; the tread looks deep and sturdy. Last photo shows camera looking at my toaster and then through the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Roboshawn

customer_reviews.title: These were awesome! The adjustable bead things in the center were ...
customer_reviews.text: These were awesome! The adjustable bead things in the center were kind of annoying but you can just cut them off a a jewelry cutting device if you have a small face like I do apparently lol. And people who are complaining about the words on the glass itself, you can just turn that piece of glass around on the inside and re-arrange everything so that it's not facing outwards. (the whole thing you can take apart essentially and it doesn't take a whole lot of time) For what it costed, these are awesome! I wear them a lot now lol
customer_reviews.author: Demitrios Zephyros

customer_reviews.title: good foundation piece for daughter's steampunk outfit.
customer_reviews.text: Hobart probably sells more of these for costumes than for actual welding. they fit ok, but since they are hard plastic they aren't the most comfortable thing on the planet to wear. each eyepiece does have a side vent and the space between eyepieces is adjustable. these come with #5 shade lenses which are a pretty dark green - honestly I was thinking these would be perfect "glacier glasses" when I put them on - but hey - they aren't that comfortable. maybe crafting a set of socket pads would help. you can of course acquire replacement 50 mm lenses in a different tint. wearing them out in the dark, at night? that'll probably be a bit of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: What do you want these to do?
customer_reviews.text: Are you using these for brazing metal parts, saving your eyes at Burning Man, or for a steampunk cosplay? They work great for anything you want to do with them. As for me, Winry Rockbell totally got wet when she saw me wearing these, Mission Accomplished!
customer_reviews.author: TeaPartyHost

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Goggle-Seller was great
customer_reviews.text: Goggles set in the middle of your eyeball, not over them. They fell apart when I tried to adjust them. Very poor quality. Seller was great about a refund though
customer_reviews.author: Alade

customer_reviews.title: Unscrew the caps if you need to adjust the width
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty simple overall. I needed to replace the band on an old pair I had, but when I saw the price of a brand new pair it didn't sense not to just pick up a new pair. They are pretty comfortable and plenty dark enough to run a torch.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for a costume (steam punk) and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a costume (steam punk) and they will fit the bill very well as they are very, very dark. However, these are legitimate welding glasses as long as you don't move them too much and let the harmful rays in under the seals. For a costume, who cares. The lens do screw in so can be replaced and this is a feature that I did not know of, but did welcome. These are higher quality than you would think for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Watchman

customer_reviews.title: Not for eclipse viewing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for eclipse viewing. Not going to be dark enough. Otherwise, they seem ok. Must add the return process was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Dhanarose

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it, 5 stars! (for the price)
customer_reviews.text: Removable lens caps, sturdy eye cup design, shade + clear protective lens. I was going to give it 4 stars just because the nose piece isn't padded and therefore slightly uncomfortable, and the strap seems to be of a type that might wear rather quickly but; then I remembered how much I paid for it! I have used much more expensive welding goggles that weren't as solid or effective as these. If you are actually using these to weld: it is important to keep in mind that these only protect your eyes, not your cheeks/face. Unless you are doing a quick cut, you should use something with more face protection.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Balcom

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: These are not even fit to use as cosplay let alone actual welding. The comfort it awful and there are gaps in the eye protection wear light can come through.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 'base' for creating steampunk goggles
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in order to mod them for steampunk. Overall I am quite satisfied as they make an excellent basis for modification at a very reasonable price. Pros: - fit well - black color makes it easy to mod/paint/glue - rigid eye-cups provide solid support - nice dark tint for welding looks great - adjustable for face width Cons: - Hard plastic where they meet the face makes them a bit uncofortable for long term wear (I plan on adding some sort of padding.) Overall much simpler than cutting brass tubing to create goggles. Hope that helps.
customer_reviews.author: James Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Works for most welding - Vin Diesel Approved
customer_reviews.text: Works for most welding. Is marginal weak for arc welding. Is too weak to protect during an eclipse (looking at the sun). Both sides stacked together only works during an eclipse (in one eye with the other closed). Comfort is OK, not great. Makes you look awesome like Vin Diesel in Riddick!!
customer_reviews.author: Nate Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: Very good glasses. Only complaint is the chain and tube ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good glasses. Only complaint is the chain and tube eyepiece connector rubs the bridge of my nose. The solution was to wrap a small piece of soft foam around the tube. The head strap isn't exactly quality and will probably have to be replaced with age. . The lenses themselves are excellent with good protection from the torch, but also able to see the surrounding room.
customer_reviews.author: Hog Driver

customer_reviews.title: Effective, minimal, retro style. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Hobart brand goggles, a trusted brand. Not suitable for welding, but great for oxyfuel cutting and spot heating especially, when the metal gets white hot. Plus, you look all retro and mad scientist-like rocking these things.
customer_reviews.author: Erich

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I like these better than the box-style. Very comfortable, but the head elastic strap could be heavier though.
customer_reviews.author: TPW

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles
customer_reviews.text: I use these for seeing my lines while plasma cutting. They work great, the lenses are interchangeable also replaceable. They come assembled with the tint lens and a clear protection lens. I saw reviews of scratches out of the box, I'm sure they were the clear set. Unscrew to remove lenses and to adjust nose Bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, quick delivery.  I don't recommend them for actual welding uses.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I wouldn't actually use them for welding. But a fun item.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L Dinnsen

customer_reviews.title: Good for steampunk modifications
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how well these would work for really welding, but to me they seem a bit uncomfortable. The part that contacts your face is hard plastic, not rubbery at all, and the connecting piece is another piece of hard plastic tube that covers a bead chain. So, comfort is dubious! However, they look cool, and they are pretty affordable. The fact they come apart helps if you want to change out the lenses or repaint them. Overall good customization "project" goggles, and pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: G. Parker

customer_reviews.title: but the build feels generally poor quality and the eye cups are a hard plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: These will do the job, but the build feels generally poor quality and the eye cups are a hard plastic that's somewhat uncomfortable. You'll have to unscrew the lens caps to adjust the spacing, but that's not a problem. The lens covers arrived scratched, which is more of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Decent goggles, a little uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The googles are decent. They provide a good amount of tint to shield your eyes from the high-intensity light created when welding. They are rather uncomfortable though. The goggle material is hard plastic and does not mold at all to individual facial features. There are two sets of lenses, the tinted lens and then a clear lens. Both are glass and both can be removed/replaced. The elastic strap doesn't work so well but is easily replaced with something that does.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Though I'm not a Welder...
customer_reviews.text: These were bought to help me with the bright lights and sunlight as my eyes are very sensitive to light. Though they may make me look like I'm "SteamPunk" outside, I don't care. My eyes are very important to me and these block the light from all angles. Since they were nicely priced, I bought more than one pair for backup parts and for the ability to double the tint in one pair if necessary, yes, my eyes are that sensitive, I'm legally blind because of this.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Pelfrey

customer_reviews.title: for real use only.
customer_reviews.text: it's fine, but the lens and lens protectors are covered in logos/lot ID/etc. For welding, this is not a problem, if you need them for a costume, be warned
customer_reviews.author: 26oo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but it does contain LEAD!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected, but disappointed that it comes with a lead warning!! ****Warning this product contains lead!!**** I bought this product to use for a Halloween costume. It was perfect, it just was concerning that it contained lead. I would not buy these if you intend to wear these for any length of time. If they take the LEAD out, it would get 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: René

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to modify for a character in an upcoming youtube production. They have a nice fit are adjustable and quite comfortable even when weighed down with extra parts, highly recommended for steam punks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Very nifty
customer_reviews.text: Work great for cutting the grass in the insane Florida sunlight (*Even though I'm not sure how healthy it is for me to use them as sun-glasses). The lenses are removable, so you can change them out if you have your own glass, or want to use the clear plastic that is with the tented lenses. Personally love the look, and would recommend them to anyone who wants a pair of steam punk goggles, with a little work they could look great. Others have mentioned them digging into their head/nose, but I haven't personally experienced any trouble with them.
customer_reviews.author: EctoSage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for costume...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves Spider-Man. Made myself a costume. That was a year ago and I’m still not allowed to take it off. It smells really bad, but these pieces were amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high quality material
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality material, looks great as a costume piece. Much better quality than buying one of those "Steampunk Goggles" costume pieces. The nose bridge is a little odd but it's adjustable, and probably not too hard to replace with something more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not a welder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a photo prop. As a photo prop it's great and some of the reasons why may be good reasons to purchase it for welding too, who knows. :) The strap is very adjustable, the lenses unscrew so you can remove the dark filters leaving just the clear protective plastic. I've applied a sheet of mylar to the lenses to create eyes that reflect. In photographs these can be very creepy.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: If I were a welder, I'd give much more of a crap.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a welder. I bought these so I could mow my lawn while not being blinded by that godawful ball of burning irradiated hate in the sky while simultaeously protecting my tender eye meats from the ungodly gauntlet of pointy low-hanging branches that is my front lawn. They fog up too quickly, but my kids love running around wearing them so I'ma keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lampkin

customer_reviews.title: Great for cosplay and more!
customer_reviews.text: Great for cosplay as well as, with the addition of dark welding lenses, for eclipse viewing. 14 power lenses are recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerman

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for costume, works for welding all the same.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for braising. The lens is just transparent enough to see through. Problem is the eye cups are hard plastic and the elastic is cheap, this makes it uncomfortable to wear for a long time. Even though it is a near toy, it still works well for what it is intended. The price is the selling point.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetjunkiTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Do exactly what I bought them to do
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use as a pair of safety goggles that, I thought, would be more interesting than your every day clear eye shields. I'm getting into wood working and these goggles keep the little bits of sanded wood and other loose particles out of my eyes. Also the shades make working outside in bright sunshine easier on the eyes (as long as you don't mind everything tinted green!). They even kept onion fumes out of my eyes. Can't say how they'd be for welding but they do every thing I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Goggles
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for a costume or to add to your wardrobe. They are plain so you can spray paint them, or adhere any spike or cogs, or whatever you want. As these ARE welding googles, the lenses were very dark. Not recommended for wearing on your face or going outside in, especially not at night. (There is a way to remove the dark lenses and use two thin, clear plastic lenses they come with, if you so desire to wear them on your face). Also, the dark lenses contain some amount of lead, so use with caution. The adjustable strap is durable, and overall I am satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: A bit uncomfortable, but excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: A bit uncomfortable to wear, and the clear lenses that come with the goggles are foggy and useless. However the tinted glass lenses are high quality, as are the goggles themselves. My only complaint is that they are rather uncomfortable to wear. I will likely add some padding to the back of the frames as they are hard inflexible plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Family

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but functional
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive, but functional. My only complaint is the nose piece, which is made of hard plastic and not very comfortable. The connection between the eye pieces though the nose piece is a metal bead chain that I thought might obstruct seeing though them, but surprisingly it doesn't at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Escamilla

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these to make into steampunk goggles. They are great for that. Hold the paint well etc. I have now ordered 10 pairs in all as my family loves them and wanted me to make them for the steampunk wedding of my daughter. If you order them for their true purpose, they are lightweight and comfortable to wear. All pluses for me as well
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Costume Piece
customer_reviews.text: While I cannot speak to how these work for their original purpose, these goggles make a great, cheap addition to any mad scientist costume. They don't have a steampunk vibe, if that's what your looking for, but do go well with more modern outfits. Both the elastic strap and the piece that goes over the bridge nose are easily adjustable to ensure a proper fit.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: For costume use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't end up using these for a costume like I wanted to but they look so awesome I keep trying to figure out a costume idea just to get them used. they are hard plastic and I'd expect to be uncomfortable but seem to wear well although I haven't tried them for long periods of time. As the picture shows you can change out the lenses, either the dark ones or the clear ones.
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great, my only complaint is that they are just a tad uncomfortable on the bridge of the nose.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Durable and multipurpose
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my Ramona Flowers cosplay and they worked out very well. I love that you can unscrew the lens and take out the shaded ones and only use the clear ones. It makes them twice as useful. They've held up after a couple of years already. Great set of goggles.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I wanted, but worked as intended
customer_reviews.text: They were used as part of a costume. They are a bit uncomfortable while wearing. They would get ditched pretty quick if I had to wear these for several hours while welding. It made my engineer costume much more Halloweeney.....
customer_reviews.author: J. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: These would make a great Halloween costume prop
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and these are definitely 6 dollar welding goggles.. they do not fit snugly around the eyes allowing light in, the lenses are hardly darker than sunglasses. overall they are uncomfortable and clunky. These would make a great Halloween costume prop, but for welding spend a few more bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lalor

customer_reviews.title: Ended up getting a refund for these. Tried them ...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up getting a refund for these. Tried them on and they are hard to see through and there is writing on the lens that gets in the way.
customer_reviews.author: perryg114

customer_reviews.title: Good outside shades
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these to look at the point of light made by a magnifying glass on wood outside, and they work great. To be clear, they are NOT for looking directly at the sun :) . They are not so dark that I can't see around me on a bright day.
customer_reviews.author: Kojovi

customer_reviews.title: Great film prop and wardrobe
customer_reviews.text: Made for a great wardrobe prop for my short film. I know they're for welding, but they do have alternative uses. They do tend to fog up after heavy use, so I do recommend putting a drop of liquid dish soap on the inside of the lens to help prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Devin WatsonTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: These are a must if you're into welding, they help keep your eyes safe and do the job, cheap and effective, just be sure not to get sparks or anything on your face if you're a noob. They are hard and look like they'll last a while, but are a tad uncomfortable after long periods, price, function, and shipping get 5/5 "Final word" Go for it, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ross Duval

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are the bare bones thing and matches their description. They do lack any sort of cushion for where they rest against the face. I will cut the rubber from an old pair of swim goggles and glue it to them to remedy this. If you want a pair to modify for costume purposes, these are a good choice. If you want a pair for welding, they're decent.
customer_reviews.author: Dagger

customer_reviews.title: He said they were great, but he had a hard time seeing out ...
customer_reviews.text: They were for my son's costume. He said they were great, but he had a hard time seeing out of them at night when he went out with his friends for Halloween.Other than that, they were great:)
customer_reviews.author: Janet Taft

customer_reviews.title: Steampunk'd these up...
customer_reviews.text: I 'steampunk' these up for peoples' costumes. The dark lenses are DARK, btw. It does come with clear lenses. The plastic doesn't take paint well, so even when using the correct type of paint, you will need to let the paint cure before wearing them. Sorry no review for their intended use though.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Native

customer_reviews.title: Bought for cosplay purposes so I can't vouch for their ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for cosplay purposes so I can't vouch for their use for welding, but they held up under spray paint ans distressing.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: easy to replace
customer_reviews.text: got these to mod into steampunk goggles. lenses are green & clear but both have writing on them. bridge nose piece really wide, easy to replace. overall they worked perfectly for what I wanted, a few more mods than expected, just really hate the writing...
customer_reviews.author: thefreakkat

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: One of the lens was scratched. Other than that its a good product
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Really uncomfortable on the nose. Not sure why they ...
customer_reviews.text: Really uncomfortable on the nose. Not sure why they designed it the way they did but I couldn't wear these things on my eyes for more than 10 minutes. A strong pinch on the nose combined with a piece of hard plastic across the nose that made it unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Scratched
customer_reviews.text: The lenses were scratched before I ever opened the package
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grinding
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grinding and brazing small items perhaps a little underpowered if your brazing all day but grinding is acceptable. Enough light to see when worn without having to remove from eyes.
customer_reviews.author: noah raczkowski

customer_reviews.title: They are great goggles
customer_reviews.text: I use them as part of a train engineer costume. They look great and the adjustable head strap and nose bridge strap make them more comfortable to wear. I don't know how well they would do for welding but they are top notch for use in a costume. They would be great for a steam punk outfit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: Actually got this for a costume (Doc Brown from back to the future). Was going to buy glasses from a costume seller, but these were actually cheaper and (more importantly) the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good for welding and cosplay
customer_reviews.text: #5 glass. Good for oxy-acetylene welding. I actually have a number of these for making cosplay goggles. Priced well and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a project.
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome basic product to be worked with in any crafting project. I am currently making a pair of steam punk goggles out of these. Though they are a bit hard on the nose the ball-chain nose piece makes for easy adjustment. The 2 sets of lenses you get with these are great quality and match to most other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Joubes

customer_reviews.title: well...theyre ok...why did i get 2?
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, straight forward. The chain between the eyes is a bit annoying. I'm pretty sure I ordered 1 and received 2. They'll be on my head most of the time as a headband. I didn't purchase for the intended use so..... it's a good first pair for Steamers. I'll probably loose them.
customer_reviews.author: studiograye

customer_reviews.title: Not good for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: The cups are made of hard plastic, the nose bridge is hard and uncomfortable as well. You also have to deal with them fogging up. If you're looking for actual oxy-acetylene or cutting glasses, search for "shade 5 glasses" and get a pair that looks like regular sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: dkobozev

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a Steampunk Costume
customer_reviews.text: This was the PERFECT addition to my steam punk costume. Who needs all the "extras" added on by some of the costume companies especially when they want to charge 4 times more than what a normal pair of goggles cost. I can't speak to using this for welding but as a costume addition they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Shell Burger

customer_reviews.title: Well.... it's goggles.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter's Steampunk costume. They are 100% pure goggles. Pros: adjustable strap, comes with tinted and clear lenses, they goggle well. Cons: I would not trust these for welding or safety glasses. They are cheap plastic, but that's why they are inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Hrasna

customer_reviews.title: Scratched
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for viewing the "Ring of Fire" eclipse in CO 05/20/2012. I typed in #14 welding goggles in a search and these came up. Didn't see in the fine print that these are #5. Oh well--my fault. But I do oxy-acetylene welding, so I thought I could use them for this purpose. Packaging is just as you'd buy it off the shelf. Clear lenses scratched one another up pretty badly. Blind spots. Will still give them a go, but c'mon, a little packaging help and these would have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Two Mustangs

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got these to round out my Halloween costume, but when my husband needed to do a little spot welding to finish up a mechanical repair he found them much handier than breaking out his big, heavy, full face welding mask. They are light weight, but not cheaply made. The plastic is thick enough to stand up to some wear. The chain across the nose makes them adjustable for comfort, and the lens frames unscrew to allow you to change out the lenses -- go darker for heavier welding protection, or add colored lenses for an excellent steampunk or post-apocalyptic costume touch.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Hurt
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sisters Halloween costume(minion). I wore them once just to see how they feel and I'm not sure she'll be able to wear them for longer than a minute or two as that's all I could stand. All plastic, no cushioning and the adjustments are pretty cheap feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help create my own steampunk goggles. Added some paint and they look awesome. Still working on them but I highly recommend them because they are easy to adjust and feel great around the eyes (for welders) or just make an awesome headpiece, for fashionable steampunk wear.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Works good. Bit dark. Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Got these mostly for cosplay. They look pretty cool, but they're hard to see out of. May eventually actually use them for their intended purpose (welding), if I need to. Possibly soldering.
customer_reviews.author: G.S. Fordham

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Great goggles for costumes! I purchased these for Steampunk and post apocalyptic costumes. The lenses are too dark to really see through, but I rarely have them over my eyes and I can easily take out the dark lenses, leaving the clear lenses in. The piece between the eyes is adjustable so you can make them fit different face shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically fora Halloween costume, but the quality on them is so good, i will actually use them for what they are intended for i like them very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Billy Raley

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very hard plastic, very uncomfortable on your face. It also leaves gaps so light enters The shade level is 5 but feels like a dark pair of sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: Chickie067

customer_reviews.title: best
customer_reviews.text: If you have never used the old style cutting glasses. you don't know what you missed. they made them this style cause these are the best. No adjusting, no side glare. your eyes stay light adjusted, with no flash
customer_reviews.author: Disco

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good for what they're meant to do
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good for what they're meant to do, protect your eyes while welding. If you're using them for costume purposes they're pretty dark and the molded plastic to fit around your nose will dig into your skull. Always adjust to fit and don't step them on super tight.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Hart

customer_reviews.title: Cosplay!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an outfit I made for Comic Con. They worked perfectly. They fit nicely and were comfortable. I was able to spray paint them and had no issues with the spray paint chipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Hobart quality, good comfort and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Good for gas welding, or just trying to look like the engineer from TF2 (or both). These are reasonably comfortable, and the ball chain bridge allows for easy width adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: PulseMaker

customer_reviews.title: Come with a clear and tinted lense set! :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these goggles for a steampunk cosplay. They are perfect. The lenses unscrew and come with the tinted, and clear lenses. They are extremly dark if you use the tinted lenses. I like the clear ones to put a colored film over. The only part I don't like is that the nose piece is a ball chain that had a black tube over it, so the chain is partially noticeable. Great quality though! Perfect for the price ! :)
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Too Cool.... for Words
customer_reviews.text: If your not a welder you shouldn't wear these so since I am a welder that makes it ok to wear these .....in public about the town? Who am I to say, I do as I do. Love them though and they keep the dang sunlight from touching my precious eyeballs.
customer_reviews.author: CUSTOMER

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Customizable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these goggles not to use for their practical application, but to customize them for a costume I was working on. The minute I received them, I knew they were perfect. They come apart and are put back together easily. Each plastic part is easily painted, the chain easily replaced, the elastic easily replaced. There were words on the glass that I did not want and they scraped off easily. Once altered, they were somewhat comfortable for wear. I think they were more comfortable to wear on the head than over the eyes, so I don't know how well that would work for practical application, but for costume application they fulfilled their goal!
customer_reviews.author: Crysiira

customer_reviews.title: Very useable... and you look good too.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for forging and for stick welding. They give enough protection to keep me from hurting myself, but still allow my weird eyeballs to see the puddle without getting blinded. Not to mention they just look cool.
customer_reviews.author: Thrakorzog

customer_reviews.title: Goggles work great!
customer_reviews.text: I use these goggles to pull ribs out of the smoker so my eyes don't get filled with smoke. There are also clear lenses behind the dark ones, so I can see better with them on at night. They are well made. However, mine have an adjustable chain in between the eye pieces.
customer_reviews.author: TNagz

customer_reviews.title: I bought them as a costume prop. Then I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought them as a costume prop. Then I made a welder and they do ok for both purposes. Welding they are a bit too light, so you probably don't want to use them for big welding operations.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Good goggles, timely manner, fair price
customer_reviews.text: My kid likes them. Got them for Romana Flowers costume, ( Scott Pilgram movie Cosplay.) Anyway, the goggles arrived in a timely manner and are good quality. I think she said they are too dark to see through easily ( eves,) but, our intent was for hair accessory anyway. Good goggles
customer_reviews.author: cameo

customer_reviews.title: Great for steampunking
customer_reviews.text: Got em in the mail and was immediately pleased. Although the lenses are a bit dark I expected that. The elastic straps are good but I will be replacing them with leather and buckles. Coincidentally the leather straps I already have fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Best of Amazon! 2013 Purchaseof the Year!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite purchase of the year so far! These are authentic welder's goggles. They put all the toys and wannabes to shame, and they were less than $10! I have seen cheap-looking knock offs costing over $70 retail down the block and just have to laugh ...
customer_reviews.author: danieltyler

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality of goggles for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great value and quality of goggles for a great price. The lenses consist of a clear plastic piece and a dark green glass lens which is rather breakable if dropped. However, these goggles were so great, I got two pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlockholmey

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with a Despicable Me Minion costume for my son I made him and they fit him great. I was worried at first because he is 7 and I wasn't sure if I was going to be able to adjust it, but it is completely adjustable and they fit him wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: CuppaKiki

customer_reviews.title: Not for welding
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use for wielding not very resistant to the arc but are cool looking and cheap. Prolly good with different lenses.
customer_reviews.author: William Wilson

customer_reviews.title: My son thinks they look cool to wear also for fun
customer_reviews.text: Worked alright for real welding (oxy/ace), though the gap in-between the eyes could be a bit shorter for me. My son thinks they look cool to wear also for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Got them this afternoon. They were suppoused to be a x-mas gift for my boyfriend, but I couldn't sit on them. I got them out and fell in love with them. Now I want a pair. We have plans to "steampunk" them in short order to go with his outfit and see how they turn out. Can't wait to order my set and fix them up! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Used these for Burning Man...
customer_reviews.text: ...and loved them. The strap/connector between the eyepieces is a little shoddy in decoration, but comfortable. Kind of annoying to adjust. Also annoying to take out and put back in the clear and uv tinted plates. Designed to be aesthetically pleasing (for the price), but not designed well for usability/functionality--and by that, I only mean for wearing, taking apart, putting back together, etc.
customer_reviews.author: B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: They look great.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a Les Claypool costume for Halloween. He typically wears steampunk-style goggles and these suited my needs perfectly. I can't personally vouch for their effectiveness in welding, but because they are welding goggles, expect everything to be dark. Really dark. While I was trying on my costume, I walked into a room where the light was on and attempted to turn the light on. Also, on the box there is a warning that this product contains lead; this scared me a bit. I assume the lead is in the tinted lenses. All in all these satisfied me with how they look.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Herberger

customer_reviews.title: loved them for what i needed to do
customer_reviews.text: love them, they came and were perfect. i bought them to make them into steampunk goggles and had no problems with them. there is real glass in them and the tint is just enough where you can still see everything.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: useless even if you only use once at an eclipse
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Hobart 770096 Welding Oxy-Acetylene Goggle - 50mm Eye Cup
product_meta.description: Rigid 50 mm dual cup eye goggles come with #5 shade for acetylene welding. Compact design with elastic headband provides years of trouble free eye protection..
feature_bullets: Ideal for use with welding applications
Rigid 50 mm dual cup for optimal eye protection
Elastic headband helps the goggles stay in place for lasting protection
Compact design for easy, durable transport

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars688 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
